a. One of the prerequisites for this job is competence in bookkeeping.
b. Here are the prerequisites that you need to purchase before coming to class.

Vietnamese: chất lượng, phẩm chất; đặc tính, năng lực, tài năng, đức tính;
Example:
a. The most important qualities we look for in a supplier are reliability and quick response.
b. The quality of their clothes has fallen ever since they started using cheaper fabrics to make them.

Vietnamese: đạt được, thu được, giành được (bằng nỗ lực được lập kế hoạc từ trước)
Example:
a. I've been trying to obtain a list of supplies from the administrator for three weeks now.
b. The employee obtained the report from her supervisor.

Vietnamese: nhẵn, trơn, mượt, phẳng lặng; trôi chảy, êm thấm; hòa nhã, lễ độ;
Example:
a. Thanks to our smooth transition to the new supplier, there was no interruption in shipments.
b. Her smooh manner won her the appreciation of the manager but not her colleagues.

Vietnamese: nguồn, nguồn gốc
Example:
a. I can’t tell you the source of this information.
b. The source of this rare pottery that we are selling in our shop is a small village in India.

Vietnamese: đồ dùng văn phòng, văn phòng phẩm (giấy để viết và bao thư)
Example:
a. We do not have enough stationery, so please order some more.
b. The new stationery featured the company’s logo in blue ink at the top of the page.

Vietnamese: (một cách) chính xác, đúng đắn, xác đáng
Example:
a. To gauge these figures accurately, we first need to get some facts from the shipping department.
b. The container company must balance the load accurately or there could be a disaster at sea.

Vietnamese: người hoặc một hãng vận chuyển
Example:
a. Lou, our favorite carrier, takes extra care of our boxes marked “fragile.”
b. Mr. Lau switched carriers in order to get a price savings on deliveries out of state.

Vietnamese: ca ta lô; lập danh mục
Example:
a. Ellen cataloged the complaints according to severity.
b. The upcoming fall catalog shows a number of items from Laos that Mr. Lau has never before been able to offer.

Vietnamese:
thực hiện, hoàn thành, làm trọn (nhiệm vụ);
đáp ứng (mong muốn, mục đích)
Example:
a. The engineers fulfilled a client’s request for larger display screens.
b. Her expectations were so high, we knew they would be hard to fulfill.

Vietnamese: tích phân;tích hợp, cần thiết cho trọn vẹn, trọn vẹn, nguyên khối, quan trọng;
Example:
a. Good customer relations is an integral component of any business.
b. A dependable stream of inventory is integral to reliable shipping of orders.
dependable : có thể tin được, đáng tin cậy, có căn cứ;

Vietnamese:
(n): (sự/bản) kiểm kê, tóm tắt; hàng hóa tồn kho, hàng trong kho;
(v): kiểm kê, tóm tắt, lập danh mục hàng hóa
Example:
a.Their inventory has not changed much over the years.
b.The store closes one day a year so that the staff can take inventory of the stockroom.

Vietnamese: giảm tới mức tối thiểu; làm giảm tầm quan trọng, làm nhỏ lại
Example:
a. The shipping staff minimized customer complaints by working overtime to deliver the packages quickly.
b. To keep the customers happy and to minimize the effect of the carrier strike, we shipped orders directly to them.

Vietnamese: có thể dùng được, có sẵn (available);
Example:
a. We had too much stock on hand, so we had a summer sale.
b. The new employee will be on hand if we need more help with shipping orders.

Vietnamese: nhớ, nhớ lại, ghi nhớ
Example:
a.I will remember the combination to the safe without writing it down.
b.I remembered the delivery clerk’s name as soon as I got off the phone.

Vietnamese: vận chuyển
Example:
a. Eva shipped the package carefully, since she knew the contents were made of glass.
b. Very few customers think about how their packages will be shipped, and are seldom home when the packages arrive.

Vietnamese: người chở hàng, công ty vận chuyển hàng; người gửi hàng
Example:
a. There is a large shipper element in these discussions.
b. The company is a shipper of bulk cargo (hàng rời) like lumber and grain.

Vietnamese: đủ, có đủ (enough);
Example:
a. The boxcar was sufficiently damaged that it could not be loaded on the truck.
b. We are sufficiently organized to begin transferring the palettes tomorrow.

Vietnamese: cung cấp, tiếp tế, đáp ứng (nhu cầu); đồ dự trữ, sự cung cấp
Example:
a.Gerald supplied the shipping staff with enough labels to last a year.
b.By making better use of our supplies, we can avoid ordering until next month.

Vietnamese:
(n): tiền phải trả, tiền công, thù lao; 
(v): tính tiền, đòi trả, bắt chịu chi phí;
Example:
a. The customer service representative was responsible for telling all existing customers that higher prices would be charged next month.
b. The extra charge for gift wrapping your purchase will appear on your invoice.

Vietnamese: thu thập, biên soạn, soạn thảo
Example:
a. I have compiled a list of the most popular items in our sales catalog.
b. The clerk is responsible for compiling the orders at the end of the day.

Vietnamese: khách hàng
Example:
a. Let's make sure all invoices sent to customers are kept in alphabetical order.
b. As part of our customer satisfaction plan, let's offer a discount to customers who pay their invoices within a week.

Vietnamese: giảm giá, chiết khấu
Example:
a. We are offering a 10 percent discount to all new customers.
b. They discounted the price on the merchandise damaged in shipment.

Vietnamese: hiệu quả, có năng suất cao
Example:
a. Electronic invoicing has helped us to be efficient.
b. The accountant was so efficient in processing the customer receipts that she had the job done before lunch.

Vietnamese: ước lượng, đánh giá; sự ước lượng, sự đánh giá
Example:
a. We estimated our losses this year at about five thousand dollars.
b. In the owner's estimation, the high level of customer satisfaction was an adequate measure of how well the company was doing.

Vietnamese:
áp đặt, ép buộc, bắt ai phải làm gì đó; đánh (thuế...), bắt chịu;
thường đi với on, upon;
Example:
a. The company will impose a surcharge for any items returned.
b. We should not impose upon our staff by requiring them to work on weekends.

Vietnamese: (n): lỗi, sai, nhầm; (v): phạm lỗi, phạm sai lầm; hiểu nhầm, nhầm lẫn;
Example:
a. I made a mistake in adding up your bill and we overcharged you twenty dollars.
b. It was a mistake thinking that my boss would be reasonable when I explained situation to him.

Vietnamese:
(n): thứ tự, trật tự, thứ, bậc, loại; mệnh lệnh, nội quy, thủ tục; sự đặt hàng, đơn đặt hàng;
(v): ra lệnh, chỉ dẫn; đặt hàng, gọi món ăn;
Example:
a. The customer placed an order for ten new chairs.
b. We were ordered to take inventory immediately, so we could account for the missing items.

Vietnamese: mau lẹ, nhanh chóng, ngay lập tức, tức thời;
Example:
a. We always reply promptly to customers’ letters.
b. The new sales agent promptly offered a full refund for the damaged goods.

Vietnamese: chỉnh lưu; sửa lại cho đúng, sửa cho đúng, sửa cho ngay;
Example:
a. He rectified the problem by giving the customer credit for the unused items that she returned.
b. Embarrassed at his behavior, he rectified the situation by writing a letter of apology.

Vietnamese: điều kiện, điều khoản; thời hạn, kỳ hạn, học kỳ, khóa học, phiên tòa
Example:
a. The terms of payment were clearly listed at the bottom of the invoice.
b. The terms of the agreement required that items be fully paid for before they would be shipped.

Vietnamese: (n): điều chỉnh, chỉnh lý, sự sửa lại cho đúng
Example:
a. An adjustment to the number of damaged items would help us align our figures.
b. With these adjustments to the numbers of screws and nuts, we are close to having an accurate count.

Vietnamese: (một cách) tự động
Example:
a.The door opens automatically.
b.The program automatically sends an e-mail response to all messages while she’s out of town.

Vietnamese: cốt yếu, chủ yếu, có tính quyết định;
Example:
a.Inventory is a crucial process and must be taken seriously by all staff.
b.Knowing how many products we have in stock is crucial to our shipping procedures.

Vietnamese: sự khác nhau, trái ngược nhau; không nhất quán/thống nhất;
Example:
a. We easily explained the discrepancy between the two counts.
b. Unless you catch the error immediately, the discrepancy gets entered into the computer and becomes very difficult to correct.

Vietnamese: quấy rầy, quấy rối, làm náo động, gây náo loạn, làm ồn, làm phiền;
Example:
a. Let's see how many products we can count in advance of inventory so we disturb fewer customers. 
b. I hope I'm not disturbing you, but I need to ask you to move so I can record the products behind you.

Vietnamese: trách nhiệm, nghĩa vụ pháp lý; nguy cơ, điều gây khó khăn trở ngại;
Example:
a. The store's insured liability protects against theft and damaged inventory.
b. The slippery steps were a terrible liability for the store.

Vietnamese: (sự) phản chiếu, phản xạ, phản ánh, hình ảnh; phê phán, nhận xét;
Example:
a. She saw her reflection in the mirror.
b. The reflection in the glass made it hard for her to distinguish how many were on the shelf.

Vietnamese: chạy, vận hành, hoạt động, thực hiện;
Example:
a. As long as the computer is running, you can keep adding new data.
b. We’ll be running inventory next weekend, so don’t make any other plans.

Vietnamese: nhìn lướt, đọc lướt; quét (ra đa, đèn, hình ảnh...);
Example:
a. The computer's optical disk scanned in the price and ordering information.
b. Jasmine quickly scanned the list to see if any information was missing.

Vietnamese: trừ đi, khấu trừ
Example:
a. Once you ring up an item, the computer automatically subtracts it from the inventory log.
b. Whoever did the inventory forgot to subtract the items that arrived damaged and were never put into the stockroom.

Vietnamese: chán ngắt, tẻ nhạt, nhạt nhẽo, buồn tẻ
Example:
a. This may be tedious work but you will be glad the inventory is accurate when you hit the busy holiday sales season.
b.Counting merchandise all weekend is the most tedious job I can imagine.

Vietnamese: kiểm tra, thẩm tra, xác minh;
Example:
a. I can't verify the accuracy of these numbers, since I was not present for inventory weekend.
b. The inventory process verifies that you have accounted for all the items that are supposed to be in the store.

Vietnamese: đồng ý, chấp thuận; đảm nhận (công việc)
Example:
a.Without hesitating, she accepted the job of teller.
b.The receptionist accepted the package from the courier.

Vietnamese: Số dư tài khoản; cân bằng/quyết toán tài khoản
Example:
a. His healthy bank balance showed a long habit of savings.
b. It took him over an hour to balance his checkbook.

Vietnamese: vay, mượn
Example:
a. Could I borrow your bike until next week?
b. The couple borrowed money from the bank to buy a home.

Vietnamese: thận trọng, cẩn thận
Example:
a.Act cautiously when signing contracts and read them thoroughly first.
b.The bank manager spoke cautiously when giving out information to people she did not know.

Vietnamese: khấu trừ
Example:
a. Homeowners can deduct the interest they pay on their mortgages.
b. The company deducts $31.93 each week from my salary for health insurance.

Vietnamese: Tiền lãi cổ phần, cổ tức;
Example:
a. The dividend was calculated and distributed to the group.
b. The stockholders were outraged when their quarterly dividends were so small.

Vietnamese: tiền đặt cọc; tiền trả trước một phần, sự trả trước một phần;
Example:
a. By making a large down payment, the couple saved a great deal in mortgage interest.
b. The most important risk factor at the time the loan is made is the size of the down payment.

Vietnamese: cầm cố, thế chấp; tiền thế chấp, khoản thế chấp
Example:
a. Hiram mortgaged his home to get extra money to invest in his business.
b. Due to low interest rates, Sheila moved quickly to find a good deal on a mortgage.

Vietnamese: bị hạn chế, bị giới hạn
Example:
a. Job opportunities are severely restricted at the moment.
b. Access to the safe deposit box cis restricted to key holders.

Vietnamese: chữ ký
Example:
a. Once we have your signature, the contract will be complete.
b. The customer’s signature was kept on file for identification purposes.

Vietnamese: rút ra, lấy ra
Example:
a. They took out the chairs in the bank lobby so now there is no place to sit.
b. My checking account allows me to take out money at any bank branch without a fee.

Vietnamese: sự giao dịch; hành động giao dịch;
Example:
a. Banking transactions will appear on your monthly statement.
b. The most common transactions can be made from your personal computer.

Vietnamese: kế toán
Example:
a. Good accounting is needed in all businesses.
b. Accounting for expenses is time-consuming

Vietnamese: tích lũy, chất đống, chồng chất; làm giàu, tích của;
Example:
a. They have accumulated more than enough information.
b. The bills started to accumulate after the secretary quit.

Vietnamese: tài sản, vốn quý;
Example:
a. The company’s assets are worth millions of dollars.
b. A sophisticated accounting system is an asset to a company.

Vietnamese: kiểm toán, báo cáo kiểm toán
Example:
a. No one looks forward to an audit by the government.
b. The independent accountants audited the company's books.

Vietnamese: ngân quỹ, ngân sách; dự toán, tiêu tốn, dự thảo ngân sách;
Example:
a.Local agencies were forced to cut their budgets by 50%. 
b.The company will have to budget more money for this department next year.

Vietnamese: Sự tăng cường, xây dựng dần lên; tăng lên, nâng cao
Example:
a. The firm has built up a solid reputation for itself.
b. Be careful, your inventory of parts is building up.

Vietnamese: khách hàng
Example:
a. We must provide excellent services for our clients, otherwise we will lose them to our competition.
b. Maintaining close contact with clients keeps the account managers aware of changing needs.

Vietnamese: khoản nợ
Example:
a. The banks are worried about your increasing debt.
b. The company has been very careful and is slowly digging itself out of debt.

Vietnamese: còn tồn tại, chưa giải quyết xong, chưa trả nợ
Example:
a. That client still has several outstanding bills.
b. Clients with outstanding bills will not receive further service until the bills are paid.

Vietnamese: có lợi, có ích; thuận lợi; sinh lãi, mang lại lợi nhuận;
Example:
a. The company used its accountant’s advice profitably.
b. We invested in the stock market profitably.

Vietnamese:
giải hoà, giảng hoà, làm cho hoà thuận;
điều hoà, làm hoà hợp, cân bằng sổ sách kế toán, cân bằng tài khoản
Example:
a. The client uses his bank statements to reconcile his accounts.
b. The accountant found the error when she reconciled the account.

Vietnamese:
doanh số, doanh thu;
tỷ lệ luân chuyển hàng hóa;
tỷ lệ thay thế nhân công;
Example:
a. We have to add another production shift to keep up with the high turnover rate.
b. The overseas branch has much lower employee turnover than does domestic operations

Vietnamese: xông xáo, tháo vát, năng nổ, linh hoạt; hung hăng, gây hấn, bạo lực;
Example:
a. Some people are risk takers and prefer to invest aggressively.
b. His ideas were not well received because he spoke so aggressively

Vietnamese: thái độ, quan điểm
Example:
a.Each investor should assess his or her own attitude toward investment.
b.The new fund manager’s attitude changed quickly after the first big downturn in the market.

Vietnamese: cam kết, ủy thác
Example:
a. It is a good idea to commit a certain percentage of your income to investments.
b. The stockbroker committed herself to finding the best investments for each client.

Vietnamese: bảo thủ, thận trọng, dè dặt;
Example:
a. Her conservative strategy paid off over the years.
b. Generally, older people should be more conservative in their investing than younger people.

Vietnamese: (n) nguồn tiền, quỹ dự trữ; kho; (v) tài trợ, cấp tiền cho;
Example:
a. He will have access to his trust fund when he is 21 years old.
b. The company will fund the trip to the conference.

Vietnamese: đầu tư
Example:
a. Don’t invest all of your time in just one project.
b. The chief financial officer invested in the stock at a very good time.

Vietnamese: dài hạn
Example:
a. The CEO’s long-term goal was to increase the return on investment.
b. Over the long-term forecast, unemployment is expected to remain steady.

Vietnamese: danh mục vốn đầu tư, danh mục đầu tư;
Example:
a. Investors are advised to have diverse portfolios.
b. The investor’s portfolio consisted of blue chip company stocks and government bonds.

Vietnamese: (v) rút ra, rút khỏi, thôi không tham gia; (n) sự rút lui
Example:
a.The pull out of the bank has left the company without financing.
b.Her advisor suggested that she pull out her investments in the troubled country.

Vietnamese: tài nguyên, tài sản
Example:
a.The company’s most valuable resource was its staff.
b.If you don’t invest in petroleum resources now, you will find that the stock prices will get away from you.

Vietnamese: tiền thu về, tiền lãi, trả lại
Example:
a.The 44 percent return on the new stock was far more than the stockbroker had anticipated.
b.Some investors are satisfied with a 15 percent return, while others want to see a much larger return.

Vietnamese: khôn ngoan, từng trải, thông thái, uyên bác;
Example:
a.If you invest wisely, you will be able to retire early.
b.Mary wisely followed her stockbroker’s advice and took her money out of some bad investments.

Vietnamese: (sự/kết quả) tính, tính toán; ‹sự› dự tính, trù liệu, sự suy xét, sự cân nhắc;
Example:
a. It took my accountant some time to complete the calculations on my income tax.
b. According to my calculations, I’ll owe less money on my income taxes this year.

Vietnamese: hạn cuối, thời hạn chót
Example:
a. My best work is done with strict deadlines.
b. The deadline for paying this year’s taxes is just two weeks away.

Vietnamese: kê khai, nộp, gửi (đơn từ, giấy tờ, tài liệu cho cơ quan nhà nước), khởi kiện;
Example:
a. If you file your taxes late, you will have to pay a fine.
b. If you believe the tax preparer gave you incorrect information, you should file a complaint with her boss.

Vietnamese: điền vào (cho đầy đủ);
Example:
a. I usually ask someone to help me fill out my tax form.
b. Don’t forget to sign the tax form after you have filled it out.

Vietnamese: ngừng, từ bỏ, bỏ cuộc;
Example:
a. Ms. Gomez is so optimistic that she never gives up.
b. Bruce gave up trying to prepare his tax return himself and now hires an accountant to do it.

Vietnamese: chung, cùng nhau;
Example:
a. We opened a joint bank account five years ago.
b. The couple no longer files joint tax returns.

Vietnamese: nợ, mắc nợ; mang ơn, hàm ơn, chịu ơn;
Example:
a. As the business grew, the owner paid back loans and owed less money.
b. I owe a lot to my parents, who have always supported and encouraged me.

Vietnamese: khoản tiền phạt, hình phạt;
Example:
a. Anyone who pays less than they should in taxes will face a penalty.
b. Penalties are imposed to discourage underpayment of taxes by adding a percentage to the taxes you already owe.

Vietnamese: (sự) chuẩn bị, sửa soạn;
Example:
a. Income tax preparation can take a long time.
b. It is important to do some preparation on your own before hiring an accountant to work on your tax form.

Vietnamese: (n, v): (n) sự trả lại tiền; (v) trả lại, hoàn lại tiền
Example:
a. With the tax refund, we bought two plane tickets.
b. The government will refund any money that you overpaid.

Vietnamese: vợ hoặc chồng
Example:
a. My spouse prepares the tax return for both of us.
b. You can claim your spouse as a dependent on your tax return if he or she doesn’t earn an income.

Vietnamese:
cố nín, cố nhịn, kìm lại, giữ lại (to refrain from, to keep from);
từ chối không làm, từ chối không cho (to refuse to do sth); 
giấu, giấu diếm (to conceal)
Lưu ý sự khác nhau:
- To withhold sth: từ chối không cho cái gì
- To refuse sth: từ chối không nhận (không chấp nhận) cái gì
Example:
a. My employer withholds money from each paycheck to apply toward my income taxes.
b. Do not withhold any information from your accountant or he will not be able to prepare your tax form correctly.

Vietnamese: thèm muốn, khao khát, ao ước;
Example:
a.We desire to have our own home.
b.He desires to retire when he becomes forty.

Vietnamese: kể chi tiết, trình bày tỉ mỉ;
Example:
a.The office manager detailed each step of the inventory process at the staff meeting.
b.Fabio created a financial statement that detailed every expected expenditure for the next quarter.

Vietnamese: dự đoán, dự báo trước
Example:
a.Analysts forecast a strong economic outlook.
b.The financial forecast indicates a deficit in the next quarter.

Vietnamese: mức, cấp, cấp bậc, trình độ
Example:
a.We have never had an accountant work at such a sophisticated level before.
b.The meeting was only open to staff at the assistant director level or higher.

Vietnamese: toàn bộ, toàn thể, tất cả; nói chung
Example:
a.Overall, our costs are running true to prediction.
b.The company’s overall expectations were out of proportion.

Vietnamese: luật xa gần, luật phối cảnh; cảnh trông xa, viễn cảnh, triển vọng
Example:
a.With more maturity and experience, you will gradually acquire perspective.
b.The budget statement will give the manager some perspective on where the costs of running the business are to be found.

Vietnamese: ước lượng, dự kiến (về mặt doanh thu)
Example:
a.We need to project our earnings and expenses in order to plan next year’s budget.
b.The director projects that the company will need to hire ten new employees this year.

Vietnamese: hiện thực, thực tế
Example:
a.Realistic expectations are important when you review your financial statements.
b.Stefano found that an accurate accounting gave him a realistic idea of his business’s financial direction.

Vietnamese: (v) đặt mục tiêu, nhắm vào, hướng vào; (n) mục tiêu, mục đích (goal)
Example:
a. We targeted March as the deadline for completing the financial statement.
b. Most managers target desired income as the primary criterion for success.

Vietnamese: (n): bản dịch, bài dịch, sự chuyển đổi.
Example:
a. The translation of the statement from Japanese into English was very helpful.
b. The accountant was able to provide a translation of the economic terms used in the meeting.

Vietnamese: tiêu biểu, điển hình; đặc thù, đặc trưng, đặc tính;
Example:
a.The director typically dominates the staff meetings.
b.Office expenses typically include such things as salaries, rent, and office supplies.

Vietnamese: sản lượng; lợi tức, hoa lợi, lợi nhuận; verb : sinh lợi, mang lại (lợi nhuận);
Example:
a.The company’s investment yielded high returns.
b.Henry’s budget gave him the desired yield: a better indication of his expected profit.

Vietnamese: ngay cạnh, liền kề
Example:
a. My office is adjacent to the receptionist area on the third floor.
b. The office manager found it very efficient to have the copier adjacent to the mail room.

Vietnamese: sự cộng tác, hợp tác
Example:
a. The manager had never seen such effective collaboration between two groups.
b. We believe that it was our collaboration that enabled us to achieve such favorable results.

Vietnamese: tập trung
Example:
a.We should concentrate our efforts on the last quarter of the year.
b.In his quiet, corner office, the manager could finally concentrate and finish his work.

Vietnamese: có ích, có lợi; cho phép, giúp cho (điều gì xảy ra);
Example:
a. The new office arrangement is much more conducive to work than the dark, depressing space the company had before.
b. Arranging chairs so that participants can see each other easily is conducive to open communication.

Vietnamese: ‹sự› đập gãy, phá vỡ; ‹sự/tình trạng› rối loạn, gián đoạn
Example:
a.The strike caused a disruption in production at the factory.
b.If there are no disruptions, the office renovations will be finished this week.

Vietnamese: làm vướng, gây vướng; cản trở, gây trở ngại;
Example:
a.The lack of supplies hampered our ability to finish on schedule.
b.Fierce storms have been hampering rescue efforts and there is now little chance of finding more survivors.

Vietnamese: thiếu thận trọng, thiếu suy nghĩ, khinh suất, sơ suất;
Example:
a. The manager inconsiderately scheduled the meeting for late Friday afternoon.
b. Mr. Peterson inconsiderately disrupted the meeting by asking a lot of irrelevant questions.

Vietnamese: hành lang, sảnh chờ; vận động hành lang.
Example:
a. The salesperson waited in the busy lobby for the buyer to see him.
b. The reception area was moved from the lobby of the building to the third floor.

Vietnamese: tăng, tiến lên, thăng tiến;
Example:
a. As the employee moved up the corporate ladder, she never forgot where she started.
b. In order to move up in the company, employees had to demonstrate their loyalty.

Vietnamese: tiếp thu, dùng được cho ai đó (to be + open to)
Example:
a.Since the junior executive was still on probation, he was open to much scrutiny and criticism.
b.What I valued most in my previous supervisor was that she was always open to ideas and suggestions.

Vietnamese: chọn lựa
Example:
a. The operations manager opted for the less expensive office design.
b. If Mary opts to join that department, you will be working together.

Vietnamese: sự nhìn chăm chú; xem xét/kiểm tra kỹ lưỡng, nghiên cứu cẩn thận;
Example:
a. After a great deal of scrutiny, the manager decided that the employee’s work had improved considerably.
b. Jim left his old job because he found it difficult to work under the close scrutiny of his boss.

Vietnamese: tuân thủ, giữ vững
Example:
a.The chairman never adhered to his own rules.
b.The bank adheres to all rules regarding the opening and closing of accounts.

Vietnamese: chương trình nghị sự, những vấn đề thảo luận tại cuộc họp
Example:
a. The board was able to cover fifteen items on the agenda.
b. The agenda was sent out three weeks ago so that everyone could prepare for the meeting.

Vietnamese: khơi mào, giới thiệu, đưa ra.
Example:
a.She's always bringing up her health problems.
b.Nobody was willing to bring up the subject of pay at the meeting.

Vietnamese: kết luận, kết thúc, chấm dứt, quyết định, ký kết.
Example:
a. The committee members concluded the meeting early so that they could finish their budgets.
b. After long discussions, the board has concluded that the project has to be canceled.

Vietnamese: (v) tiến hành; (n) sự tiến bộ, sự được phép (làm gì);
Example:
a. Five of the six members felt that they should go ahead with the plan.
b. The manager was just waiting for the go ahead from her boss before mailing the report.

Vietnamese: mục đích, mục tiêu; khung thành, cầu môn; bàn thắng, điểm;
Example:
a. Employees are expected to analyze and evaluate their annual goals.
b. The director had to report to the committee that his department would not reach its goal of 35 percent growth.

Vietnamese: lâu, dài, dài dòng;
Example:
a. After lengthy discussions, the chairperson was reelected for another term.
b. The report was so lengthy that members had to take it home and read it over the weekend.

Vietnamese: nội dung, sự kiện, chủ đề, vấn đề, việc, chuyện;
Example:
a. If there are no other matters to discuss, we will conclude the meeting.
b. This is not the place to bring up personal matters.

Vietnamese: định kỳ, thường kỳ, chu kỳ;
Example:
a. The group tried to meet periodically.
b. Periodically, new members were nominated to the committee.

Vietnamese: ‹quyền/sự› ưu tiên, được xét trước
Example:
a. Since the remaining issues were not a priority, the group decided to move them to the next week’s agenda.
b. The manager was ineffective because she was unable to set priorities.

Vietnamese: ‹sự› tiến tới, tiến bộ, phát triển; ‹sự› tiến hành, tiến triển; (v) tiến tới, tiến triển
Example:
a. The executive committee asked each group to present a report showing their progress for the year.
b. Progress is being made on the annual report; we expect to see a finished product by next week.

Vietnamese: (v) lãng phí; (n) sự lãng phí; đồ bỏ đi, đồ thải ra
Example:
a. Without a leader, the group members wasted time and energy trying to organize themselves.
b. The meeting wasn’t a waste of time, but the members had hoped to accomplish more than they did.

Vietnamese: nhãn hiệu, nhãn hàng, chi nhánh;
Example:
a. Consumers often buy highly advertised brands of athletic shoes.
b. All brands of aspirin are the same.

Vietnamese: làm cho phù hợp, làm cho thích hợp; thích nghi với, thích ứng với, tuân theo;
Example:
a.Our safety standards conform to those established by the government.
b.The quality control manager insisted that every product that left the plant conform to the company’s rigorous standards.

Vietnamese: khuyết điểm, nhược điểm; thiết sót, sai sót, lỗi;
Example:
a. Because of a defect in stitching, the entire suit was thrown out.
b. One way to sell a product with a defect is by labeling it as such and reducing the price.

Vietnamese: nâng cao, tăng cường;
Example:
a.A stylish color enhances the appeal of a car.
b.The reason behind quality control is to enhance the company’s reputation for superior products.

Vietnamese: áo quần, may mặc;
Example:
a.The garment workers are accountable for production mistakes.
b.Every garment must be carefully inspected for defects before it is shipped.

Vietnamese: thanh tra, kiểm tra, xem xét kỹ;
Example:
a. A quality control agent who does not inspect every product carefully can ruin his company’s reputation.
b. Children’s car seats are thoroughly inspected and tested for safety before being put on the market.

Một nhân viên kiểm tra chất lượng sản phẩm mà không kiểm tra kỹ lưỡng mọi sản phẩm có thể hủy hoại danh tiếng của công ty (anh ấy).
Chổ ngồi trên xe ô-tô của trẻ em được xem xét và kiểm nghiệm kỹ lưỡng trước khi đưa ra thị trường.

Vietnamese: nhận thức được, cảm giác được, cảm thụ được;
Example:
a.It takes a perceptive person to be a good manager
b.Dora always hires good workers because she is very perceptive about people’s abilities.

Vietnamese: chống lại, đẩy lùi; khước từ, cự tuyệt; làm khó chịu, căm phẫn;
Example:
a.Faulty products repel repeat customers.
b.Umbrellas that do not repel water should never be passed through quality control.

Vietnamese: rút lui, rút lại; lấy lại, kéo lại, đồng ý nhận lại, chấp nhận cho ai trở lại;
Example:
a. Good quality control significantly limits the number of products taken back for a refund.
b. The quality inspector took the shoddy work back to the assembly line to confront the workers.

Vietnamese: vứt bỏ, bỏ đi, đuổi đi;
Example:
a. It is cheaper to throw out shoddy products than to lose customers.
b. The factory decided to throw out hundreds of lightbulbs that might have been damaged, rather than lose customers.

Vietnamese: đồng đều, thống nhất, không thay đổi;
Example:
a.The principles were applied uniformly across all the departments
b.The products are checked to make sure they are uniformly packaged before they leave the factory

Vietnamese: vết nhăn, vết nhàu, nếp quần áo;
Example:
a. A wrinkle in the finish can be repaired more economically before a sale than after.
b. A wrinkle that is ironed into a permanent-press product will annoy the consumer each time the garment is worn.
c. A permanent press is a characteristic of fabric that has been chemically processed to resist wrinkles and hold its shape

Vietnamese: lo âu, băn khoăn
Example:
a.The drought has made farmers anxious about the harvest.
b. The developers were anxious about the sales forecast for the new product.

Vietnamese: mối lo âu, sự băn khoăn, lo lắng;
Example:
a.Children normally feel a lot of anxiety about their first day at school.
b.The fear of unemployment can be a source of deep anxiety to many people.

Vietnamese: biết chắc, xác định rõ ràng, tìm hiểu chắc chắn, phát hiện ra, nhận ra;
Example:
a.A necessary part of product development is to ascertain whether the product is safe.
b.A customer survey will help to ascertain whether there is a market for the product.

Vietnamese: cho rằng, cho là đúng; giả vờ, giả bộ; đảm đương, gánh vác, chịu trách nhiệm;
Example:
a.The young man felt ready to assume the new responsibilities of his promotion.
b.I assumed (that) you knew each other because you went to the same school.

Vietnamese: thập kỷ
Example:
a.Each decade seems to have its own fad products.
b.After a decade of trying, the company finally developed a vastly superior product.

Vietnamese: khám xét, xem xét; khảo sát, nghiên cứu; hỏi thi, sát hạch, thẩm vấn;
Example:
a.Before marketing a new product, researchers must carefully examine it from every aspect.
b.Good researchers have to examine every possible option, including some that seem bizarre.

Vietnamese: (v) làm thí nghiệm; (n) cuộc thí nghiệm, sự thí nghiệm, sự thử
Example:
a. Product developers must conduct hundreds of experiments in their research.
b. After designing a new product, researchers continue experimenting to determine whether it has other uses.

Vietnamese: hợp lý, có lý, hợp với lôgic, theo lôgic;
Example:
a.It is only logical for a research and development team to concentrate on one or two new products at a time.
b.In addition to logical thinkers, a good research and development team should include a few dreamers.

Vietnamese: sự nghiên cứu
Example:
a.For toy manufacturers, research can be pure fun.
b.Part of the research the team does is to determine whether similar products are already on the market.

Vietnamese: bổn phận, trách nhiệm, nhiệm vụ
Example:
a.Another responsibility of product development is to ensure that there will be a demand for the product.
b.The product development department has a huge responsibility to be sure that the product is safe, even if used improperly.

Vietnamese: giải quyết, làm sáng tỏ một vấn đề;
Example:
a. Researchers find that every time they solve one problem, two more result.
b. One of the biggest problems to solve is why people would want to own the new product.

Vietnamese: người giám sát
Example:
a.A good supervisor gets his team to work with him, not just for him.
b.The department supervisor has to balance his department’s responsibili­ties in order to keep the president satisfied with its progress.

Vietnamese: có hệ thống, có phương pháp (methodically);
Example:
a.While creative thinking is necessary, analyzing a problem systematically is indispensable.
b.Once the creative development is completed, the department works systematically toward making the idea a reality.

Vietnamese: sợ hãi, e sợ;
Example:
a. Most new home buyers are apprehensive about their decision.
b. The mortgage lender was apprehensive about the company’s ability to pay.

Vietnamese: trường hợp, hoàn cảnh, tình huống, tình thế;
Example:
a. Under the current economic circumstances, they will not be able to purchase the property.
b. If the circumstances change in the near future and we have new properties, we will be sure to call you.

Vietnamese: điều kiện; hoàn cảnh, tình thế, tình trạng, trạng thái;
Example:
a. Except for some minor repairs, the building is in very good condition.
b. There are certain conditions that are unique to leasing a property.

Vietnamese: bởi, vì, do, tại, nhờ có;
Example:
a. Due to the low interest rates, good office space is difficult to find.
b. He didn’t believe that the low prices were due only to the neighborhood.

Vietnamese: dao động, thay đổi bất thường
Example:
a. No one is very comfortable making a large investment while the currency values fluctuate almost daily.
b. Prime business areas fluctuate with local economies, crime rates, and cost of living indices.

Vietnamese: sự giao động
Example:
a.Employers can adjust their workforce in line with fluctuations in demand for goods and services.
b. Long-term investment trusts compensate investors for the day-to-day fluctuation of the stock market.

Những người chủ có thể điều chỉnh lực lượng lao động trong dây chuyền (sản xuất) theo nhu cầu của hàng hóa và dịch vụ.
Sự tin tưởng đầu tư dài hạn sẽ đền đáp cho các nhà đầu tư trong thị trường chứng khoán dao động như cơm bữa.

Vietnamese: thôi, mất, bỏ, từ bỏ, rời bỏ, tránh né, thoát khỏi
Example:
a. The agent wasn’t sure if the executives could get out of their prior real estate arrangement.
b. The company wanted to get out of the area before property values declined even further.

Vietnamese: ‹người/vật/chất› chỉ, chỉ thị (VD: đồng hồ chỉ thị, đèn xi-nhan);
Example:
a. If the economy is an accurate indicator, rental prices will increase rapidly in the next six months.
b. The results of the elections were seen as an important indicator of the stability in the area.

Vietnamese: (n) hợp đồng cho thuê; (v) cho thuê
Example:
a.They decided to lease the property rather than buy it.
b.With the lease expiring next year, they need to start looking for a new location as soon as possible.

Vietnamese: ràng buộc chặt, không thể thay đổi;
Example:
a. The company locked itself into a ten-year lease that they didn’t want.
b. Before you lock yourself into something, check all your options.

Vietnamese: sở hữu, chiếm hữu; chiếm giữ, chiếm đóng, kiểm soát;
Example:
a.Our company has occupied this office for more than five years.
b.Tenants are usually allowed to occupy their space beginning on the first day of the month.

Vietnamese: sự/quyền lựa chọn; vật/điều được chọn; tùy chọn;
Example:
a. You could arrange the lease with an option to buy after a certain amount of time.
b. With the real estate market so tight right now, you don’t have that many options.

Vietnamese: lệ thuộc vào, tùy theo; tuân thủ;
Example:
a.The go-ahead to buy is subject to the president’s approval.
b.This contract is subject to all the laws and regulations of the state

Vietnamese: (lời) kêu gọi, cầu khẩn; ‹sức› hấp dẫn, lôi cuốn, thu hút, quyến rũ;
Example:
a.A restaurant with good food and reasonable prices has a lot of appeal
b.The pleasing decor and friendly waiters are what give that restaurant its appeal.

Vietnamese: đến, đi đến, tới nơi;
Example:
a. By the time our meal arrived, it was cold.
b. Frank arrived at the restaurant only minutes after Claudia left.

Vietnamese: (n) sự thỏa hiệp; (v) thỏa hiệp, dàn xếp
Example:
a. The couple made a compromise and ordered food to take out.
b. John doesn’t like sweet dishes so I compromised by adding just a small amount of sugar.

Vietnamese: táo bạo, cả gan, phiêu lưu, dũng cảm (bravely);
Example:
a. We daringly ordered the raw squid.
b. Bob daringly asked to see the menu in French.

Vietnamese: quen, quen thuộc, thân thuộc, phổ biến, tương tự;
Example:
a. It’s nice to see some familiar items on the menu.
b. The chef blends the familiar tastes with the unusual.

Vietnamese: hướng dẫn viên, người chỉ dẫn; sách hướng dẫn, biển chỉ dẫn;
Example:
a.I don’t know where to go, so why don’t we consult the guide
b.The guide led our tour group to a small restaurant only known to the locals.

Vietnamese: phần lớn, đa số;
Example:
a. The majority of the group wanted to try the new Chinese restaurant.
b. Claude was in the majority, so he was very pleased with the decision.

Vietnamese: trộn lẫn, pha lẫn; (n) sự kết hợp, hỗn hợp, sự hòa hợp;
Example:
a. The daring chef mixed two uncommon ingredients.
b. The mix of bright colors on the plate was very pleasing.

Vietnamese: tin cậy vào, dựa vào;
Example:
a. I have always relied on the restaurant advice this guidebook gives.
b. I seldom rely on the restaurant reviews in the paper when choosing a restaurant.

Vietnamese: tìm được, đạt được (cái gì khó khăn), buộc chặt, đảm bảo an toàn (khỏi nguy hiểm hoặc đe dọa)
Example:
a.The hostess secured us another chair, so we could eat together.
b.Despite the popularity of the restaurant, Max was able to secure reservations for this evening.

Vietnamese: chủ quan; tưởng tượng, có tính tưởng tượng;
Example:
a.The reviews in this guidebook are highly subjective, but fun to read.
b.Food preferences are subjective and not everyone agrees on what tastes good.

Vietnamese: đề nghị, ý kiến, gợi ý;
Example:
a. Can I make a suggestion about what to order?
b. We followed the waiter’s suggestion and ordered one of the specials.

Vietnamese: sự ngon miệng, sự thèm ăn
Example:
a.All that walking has given me an appetite.
b.I haven't got much of an appetite (= I am not hungry).
The children all have healthy/good appetites (= they eat a lot).

Vietnamese: đầy đủ, trọn vẹn, hoàn thành
Example:
a. We ordered some dessert to complete our meal.
b. Some restaurants want to hear their customers’ opinions and ask them to complete a short evaluation form.

Vietnamese: sự hoàn thành, sự làm xong
Example:
a.I'm pleased to say the project is nearing completion.
b.The cost of completion has been revised upwards again due to inflation.

Vietnamese: kích thích, kích động, khuấy động;
Example:
a. Exotic flavors always excite me.
b. The new Asian restaurant has excited the interest of many people.

Vietnamese: mùi vị, hương vị, mùi thơm phảng phất;
Example:
a. Fusion cooking is distinguished by an interesting mix of flavors.
b. The cook changed the flavor of the soup with a unique blend of herbs.

Vietnamese: quên
Example:
a. The waiter forgot to bring the rolls, annoying the customer.
b. Don’t forget to tell your friends what a great meal you had tonight.

Vietnamese: thành phần, thành tố, phần hợp thành;
Example:
a.I was unfamiliar with some of the ingredients in the dish.
b.The chef went to the farmer’s market to select the freshest ingredients for tonight’s menu.

Vietnamese: xét xử, phân xử, xét đoán, phán đoán; đánh giá, cho rằng;
Example:
a.The restaurant review harshly judged the quality of the service.
b.Hector was not familiar with Asian cooking, so he was unable to judge if the noodles were cooked correctly.

Vietnamese:
1 lỗi gây ra sự nhầm lẫn, lộn xộn;
(sự) lộn xộn, hỗn độn, hỗn loạn; cuộc đánh lộn;
Example:
a. There was a mix-up in the kitchen so your order will be delayed.
b. There was a mix-up about the ingredients and the dish was ruined.

Vietnamese: khách hàng quen, người bảo trợ, người đỡ đầu, nhà tài trợ;
Example:
a.This restaurant has many loyal patrons.
b.Once the word was out about the new chef, patrons lined up to get into the restaurant.

Vietnamese: dự đoán, dự báo
Example:
a. I predicted this restaurant would become popular and I was right.
b. Kona was unable to predict what time Andy, who is always late, would show up at the restaurant.

Vietnamese: ‹một cách› ngẫu nhiên, tình cờ, hú họa, ẩu
Example:
a. We randomly made our selections from the menu.
b. That chef chooses his spices randomly, but his dishes always taste great.

Vietnamese: nhắc nhở, làm nhớ lại;
Example:
a.I remind the client that we are meeting for dinner tomorrow.
b.Ms. Smith was annoyed at having to remind the waitress to bring the check.

Vietnamese: cơ bản, cơ sở
Example:
a. The new restaurant offers a very basic menu.
b. The restaurant manager ordered enough basic supplies to get through the first month.

Vietnamese: gánh nặng (đen & bóng), gánh trách nhiệm;
Example:
a.The deliveryman’s back ached from the heavy burden he carried.
b.The secretary usually takes on the burden of ordering lunch for business meetings.

Vietnamese: thông thường, phổ biến;
Example:
a.The restaurants in this area commonly serve office workers and are only open during the week.
b.The people who work in this building commonly order their lunch from the sandwich shop on the first floor.

Vietnamese: giao hàng
Example:
a.The caterer hired a courier to make the delivery.
b. The restaurant is reluctant to make deliveries, but makes an exception for our office.

Vietnamese: ‹tính/sự› thanh lịch, tao nhã;
Example:
a. The elegance of the restaurant made it a pleasant place to eat.
b. A sandwich may lack elegance, but it makes a convenient and inexpensive lunch.

Vietnamese: bắt đầu vào việc, bắt tay vào việc; rơi vào tay của, trở thành trách nhiệm của ai đó;
Example:
a. The task of preparing the meal fell to the assistant chef when the chief chef was ill.
b. The menu was in French, so ordering for us fell to Monique, who spoke French.

Vietnamese: gây ấn tượng, khắc sâu, ghi sâu
Example:
a. I was impressed with how quickly they delivered our lunch.
b. If you want to impress the new staff member, order her a nice lunch.

Vietnamese: cá nhân, riêng lẻ, khác biệt;
Example:
a. We had the delivery man mark the contents of each individual order.
b. The jaunty whistle of the delivery woman marked her individual style.

Vietnamese: danh sách
Example:
a. The office manager compiled a list of everyone’s order.
b. We keep a list of all the restaurants in this area that deliver.

Vietnamese: adj : nhiều, nhiều mối, nhiều phần; noun : bội số;
Example:
a. The delivery person was not able to keep track of the multiple order, causing a food mix-up.
b. It takes multiple steps to get into this building, which frustrates all our employees.
18 is a multiple of 3, because 18 = 3 x 6.

Vietnamese: chật, hẹp; hạn chế; kỹ, tỉ mỉ
Example:
a. Etseko narrowed the restaurant possibilities down to three.
b. This restaurant delivers only pizza and sandwiches, so that certainly narrows down the choices.

Vietnamese:
đón ai đó, nhặt lên, trả lời điện thoại;
chở ai đó/cái gì đó đến nơi nào đó.
Example:
a. The delivery man picks up lunch orders on his motor scooter.
b. If you ask me nicely, I will pick up the order on my way home.

Vietnamese: đền bù cho, thanh toán / trả tiền, chọn
Example:
a. We settled the bill with the cashier.
b. After much debate, we finally settled on the bistro on the corner.

Vietnamese: làm quen với cái gì
Example:
a. Chefs must accustom themselves to working long hours.
b. It can be hard to accustom oneself to eating new types of food.

Vietnamese: người học việc, người tập sự, người mới vào nghề
Example:
a. Instead of attending cooking school, Raul chose to work as an apprentice with an experienced chef.
b. The cooking school has an apprentice program that places students in restaurants to gain work experience.

Vietnamese: (thuộc) nấu nướng, bếp núc
Example:
a. The chef was widely known for his culinary artistry.
b. His interest in culinary arts drew him to a commercial foods program.

Vietnamese: đòi hỏi, yêu cầu; cần phải
Example:
a. Theodore was always exhausted because his new job at the restaurant demanded so much of him.
b. This style of cooking demands many exotic ingredients and a lot of preparation time.

Vietnamese:
(v): vẽ, vạch, thảo ra; kéo, lôi kéo, thu hút, lôi cuốn
(n): sức lôi cuốn/quyến rũ; (người/vật) có sức lôi cuốn/quyến rũ; sự kéo, cố gắng;
Example:
a. We hope the new restaurant will draw other business to the area.
b. Matthew was drawn to a career in cooking.

Vietnamese: sáp nhập, hợp nhất; kết hợp; hợp thành tổ chức/đoàn thể
Example:
a. Coca incorporated the patron's suggestions into her new menu.
b. Here are the fresh greens for you to incorporate into a salad.

Vietnamese: sự chảy vào, sự tràn vào; luồng đi vào, dòng đi vào;
Example:
a. An influx of new chefs is constantly needed to fill open jobs.
b. Due to the rise in popularity of cooking as a career, cooking schools report an influx of applications.

Vietnamese: phương pháp, cách thức;
Example:
a. Gloria perfected a simple method for making croissants.
b. Many chefs borrow cooking methods from a variety of cultures and incorporate them into their cooking style.

Vietnamese: chỗ thoát ra, lối ra, lối thoát; phương tiện để thỏa mãn
Example:
a. Even before he became a professional baker, Jacob used baking as an outlet for frustration.
b. Many people find cooking to be a hands-on outlet for their creativity.

Vietnamese: nghề chuyên môn, nghề nghiệp
Example:
a. Cooking is considered as much a profession as is law or medicine.
b. Lulu took up cooking as her profession and is very happy with her decision.

Vietnamese: bỏ, từ bỏ; buông, thả;
Example:
a. People find it hard to relinquish their accustomed food preferences and try something new.
b. After Claude married Kiki, he had to relinquish his exclusive hold on the kitchen and learn to share the joys of cooking.

Vietnamese: đề tài, chủ đề; mô-típ (motif);
Example:
a. The caterers prepared food for a party with a tropical island theme.
b. The restaurant's food and decor demonstrated its southwestern theme.

Vietnamese: giúp, giúp đỡ, trợ giúp
Example:
a. Bonnie hired a secretary to assist her with the many details of the event.
b. The hotel manager was able to assist us with some last-minute advice.

Vietnamese: phối hợp, kết hợp, điều phối, sắp xếp;
Example:
a. Benet tried to coordinate all departments to make sure the event ran smoothly.
b. The colors of the flowers were ordered to coordinate with the colors in the corporate logo.

Vietnamese: (n): kích thước, chiều, cỡ, khổ;
Example:
a. What are the dimensions of the ballroom?
b. We need the dimensions of the meeting rooms before we can determine how many chairs each will hold.

Vietnamese: chính xác, đúng đắn;
Example:
a. We will need an exact head count by noon tomorrow.
b. The exact measurements of the room are unknown, but we can guess.

Vietnamese: chung, tổng quát, toàn thể
Example:
a. We have a general idea of how many guests will attend.
b. In general, about half the guests will bring their spouses.

Vietnamese: lý tưởng, đúng như lý tưởng, theo lý tưởng
Example:
a. Ideally, the location for the concert would have plenty of parking.
b. Lucy explained that ideally her wedding would take place on the beach, but she realized it might be difficult to arrange.

Vietnamese: thời gian thực hiện;
Example:
a. The lead time for reservations is unrealistic.
b. We will need to give the caterer enough lead time to cut the cake.

Vietnamese: noun: kế hoạch, đồ án, sơ đồ; verb : (vẽ/lập/đặt) kế hoạch, đồ án, sơ đồ, dự định;
Example:
a. We plan to get together tomorrow to discuss the menu.
b. Planning their wedding was a source of tension for the young couple.

Vietnamese: sự gần, trạng thái gần, xấp xỉ, lân cận;
Example:
a. The fans were worried by the proximity of the storm clouds.
b. An important factor in selecting the site was its close proximity to a parking garage.

Vietnamese: điều chỉnh, chỉnh đốn; quy định
Example:
a. The state strictly regulates the preparation of food for public consumption.
b. The site staff closely regulates how many cars can be brought on the grounds.

Vietnamese: nơi, chỗ, vị trí, địa điểm, khu đất;
Example:
a. Once we saw the site, we knew it would be perfect for the event.
b. The manager of the site was most helpful.

Vietnamese: trình diễn, dàn cảnh, sân khấu, sắp xếp, tổ chức;
Example:
a. The gazebo outside was the perfect location from which to stage the cutting of the cake.
b. A historic house can be the perfect site to stage a small reception.

Vietnamese: đại lý, đại diện (của một công ty);
Example:
a. A travel agent can usually find you the best deals on tickets and hotels.
b. You can buy your ticket from the ticket agent at the train station right before you get on the train.

Vietnamese: (sự/lời) thông báo, công bố, tuyên bố; cáo thị, thông cáo;
Example:
a. Did you hear an announcement about our new departure time?
b. I expect an announcement any time now about a snow emergency at the airport.

Vietnamese: đồ uống, thức uống (tất cả các loại, trừ nước lọc)
Example:
a. The flight attendant offered all passengers a cold beverage during the flight.
b. The restaurant had a range of beverages on the drinks menu, including soft drinks and juices.

Vietnamese: (n): chăn, mền; lớp phủ; (v): phủ lên, che phủ, trùm, đắp
Example:
a. It's going to be a cold night so I'll ask housekeeping to send an extra blanket for our bed.
b. The snow blanketed the windshield, making it difficult to see the roads.

Vietnamese: (v): lên tàu (máy bay, tàu thủy, xe lửa); (n): boong tàu; ban, bộ, ủy ban;
Example:
a. For security reasons, visitors are not allowed in the area of the airport where passengers board the planes.
b. We will board the train for New York in ten minutes.

Vietnamese: đòi hỏi, yêu cầu; tuyên bố, xác nhận; khai báo; nhận lại, lấy lại;
Example:
a. Please proceed directly to the baggage arrival area to claim your luggage.
b. Lost luggage can be claimed at the airline office.

Vietnamese: chậm trễ, trì hoãn, hoãn lại;
Example:
a. The bus was delayed due to inclement weather.
b. The heavy traffic delayed our arrival at the train station.

Vietnamese: sự cho lên tàu, máy bay;
Example:
a.Cruise passengers are given a pass for embarkation when they check in at the dock.
b.The flight crew must check the passengers' documents before embarkation.

Vietnamese: tuyến đường, hành trình; nhật ký đường đi, sách hướng dẫn du lịch;
Example:
a. He reviewed the itinerary the travel agent had faxed him before purchasing the ticket.
b. I had to change my itinerary when I decided to add two more countries to my vacation.

Vietnamese: cấm, ngăn cấm (to ban); ngăn chặn (to prevent);
Example:
a. We were prohibited from wearing casual clothes in the office.
b. Airline regulations prohibit the passengers from having beverages open during takeoff and landing.

Vietnamese: có giá trị, có hiệu lực, hợp lệ (đặc biệt về mặt pháp lý);
Example:
a. I need to make certain that my passport is valid if we plan to go overseas this December.
b. The officer's argument for increased airport security seemed valid at the time.

Vietnamese: giải quyết, đối phó, xử lý;
Example:
a.Ticket agents must deal courteously with irate customers.
b.Sick passengers, frightened children, and rude pilots are just a few of the things cabin attendants have to deal with.

Vietnamese: nơi đến, nơi tới, đích đến, mục đích;
Example:
a.The Great Barrier Reef is a popular tourist destination this year.
b.Once you have determined your desired destination, we can work toward getting the best airfare.

Vietnamese: phân biệt, nhận ra; phân thành, chia thành, xếp thành loại;
Example:
a.Suki was able to distinguish between the different types of jets on the runway.
b.My travel agent has distinguished herself as being one of the best in our area.

Vietnamese: tiết kiệm
Example:
a.My travel agent knows I like to economize and always looks out for the best prices for me.
b.We decided to economize this year and take our vacation during the off season, when prices are lower.

Vietnamese: tương đương
Example:
a.Carlos used the Internet to search for hotels of equivalent dollar value to the one recommended.
b.The food the airline serves in coach class is equivalent to that served in first class.

Vietnamese: cuộc đi chơi/du ngoạn; cuộc đi chơi tập thể (giá hạ + có thời hạn);
Example:
a.With some time between meetings in London, the company president enjoyed an excursion to Stonehenge.
b.The finance officer was pleased to find an excursion for the entire consulting team.

Vietnamese: phí tổn
Example:
a.A luxury vacation involves many expenses.
b.If we keep our expenses down, we might have enough money to take a longer trip.

Vietnamese: mở rộng, kéo dài, gia hạn; duỗi ra, đưa ra (cũng hiểu theo nghĩa offer);
Example:
a.We extended our vacation by a day.
b.Our wonderful travel agent extended the full services of her firm to us.

Vietnamese: (thuộc) tương lai, triển vọng;
Example:
a.The airline had a reception to impress travel agents who might be prospective clients.
b.I narrowed my list of prospective destinations to my three top choices.

Vietnamese: vị trí, địa thế; tình huống, hoàn cảnh; việc làm, chỗ làm;
Example:
a.The airline suggested I check with the State Department regarding the political situation in the country I'm flying to.
b.The vast number of different airfares available makes for a complicated situation.

Vietnamese: về thực chất, về bản chất, về cơ bản; lớn lao, đáng kể;
Example:
a.The airline I work for had a substantially higher rating for customer satisfaction than our competitors had.
b.The airfares charged by different airlines are not substantially different.

Vietnamese: hệ thống, hệ thống phân loại, chế độ (hoạt động, xã hội...);
Example:
a.The airline system covers the entire world with flights.
b.We need a better system to keep track of how much money we are spending on this vacation.

Vietnamese: bao hàm, toàn diện; mau hiểu, lĩnh hội nhanh;
Example:
a. The conductor has a comprehensive knowledge of rail systems from all over the world.
b. Our travel agent gave us a comprehensive travel package, including rail passes.

Vietnamese: xa xỉ, xa hoa; thuộc loại sang trọng/thượng hạng
Example:
a. My parents decided to splurge on deluxe accommodations for their trip.
b. The train station is not near any of the deluxe hotels, so we will have to take a taxi.

Vietnamese: danh mục, danh bạ, danh bạ điện thoại; sách chỉ dẫn/hướng dẫn
Example:
a. We consulted the directory to see where the train station was located.
b. By calling directory assistance, Mr. Scannel was able to get the phone number for the train station.

Vietnamese: khoảng thời gian
Example:
a. Mother lent me her spare jacket for the duration of the trip.
b. Despite our personal differences, my roommate and I agreed to be as pleasant as possible for the duration of the train ride.

Vietnamese:
cho phép làm cái gì, cho phép có cái gì
→ (dạng bị động) có quyền được làm cái gì, có quyền được có cái gì
Example:
a. During the holiday rush, a train ticket entitled the passenger to a ride, but not necessarily a seat.
b. The mess the train line made of Pedro's sleeping room reservations entitle him to a free upgrade to a better room.

Vietnamese: tiền xe, tiền vé (tàu, xe..)
Example:
a. The train fare has increased since I rode last.
b. Pay your fare at the ticket office and you will get a ticket to board the train.

Vietnamese: bù lại, bù đắp, đền bù; in ốp-sét;
Example:
a. The high cost of the hotel room offset the savings we made by taking the train instead of the plane.
b. By reducing her transportation costs once in the United States, Mrs. Sato offset the cost of getting to this country.

Vietnamese: hoạt động, chạy (máy); thao tác, thực hiện, tiến hành, triển khai...
Example:
a. The train operates on a punctual schedule.
b. The train only operates in this area at the height of the tourist season.

Vietnamese: đúng giờ, không chậm trễ;
Example:
a. Please be on time; the train leaves punctually at noon.
b. The train usually arrives punctually; I can't imagine what is delaying it today.

Vietnamese: tương đối, vừa phải, hơi; có quan hệ với, có liên quan;
Example:
a. The train is relatively empty for this time of day.
b. The train station has been relatively busy for a weekday.

Vietnamese: phần còn lại, chỗ còn lại; số dư, phần dư (toán học);
Example:
a. The Alaskan frontier has train service in the summer, but for the remainder of the year the tracks are impassable.
b. We will move you to a less expensive room and credit the remainder of what you've already paid to your charge card.

Vietnamese: xa, xa xôi, xa xăm; xa cách, hẻo lánh, cách biệt;
Example:
a. I was surprised to find train service to such a remote location.
b. We took the train out of the city and found a remote hotel in the country for the weekend.

Vietnamese: sự hấp dẫn, sức lôi cuốn;
Example:
a. It's a programme designed to appeal mainly to 16 to 25-year-olds.
b. I think what appeals to me about his painting is his use of colour.

Vietnamese: tiên tiến, tiến bộ, cấp tiến; cấp cao, ở mức cao
Example:
a. Since the hotel installed an advanced computer system, all operations have been functioning more smoothly.
b. Pablo has been promoted to assistant manager and he is happy with his advanced position.

Vietnamese: dây xích, dây chuyền, dãy, chuỗi, loạt (khách sạn, nhà hàng...)
Example:
a. Budget-priced hotel chains have made a huge impact in the industry.
b. The hotel being built in Seoul is the newest one in the chain.

Vietnamese: làm thủ tục đăng ký (để vào khách sạn, vào hội nghị, lên máy bay...)
Example:
a.Patrons check in at the hotel immediately upon their arrival.
b.To know that the conference guests have arrived, we ask them to check in at the registration desk.

Vietnamese: mong chờ, mong đợi, hy vọng; đòi hỏi; cho rằng, nghĩ rằng;
Example:
a. You can expect a clean room when you check in at a hotel.
b. Mr. Kim expected that the bed linens would be changed daily.
If you say that a woman is expecting, you mean that she is pregnant.

Vietnamese:
bà quản gia; người coi nhà, người giữ nhà; 
nhân viên trực buồng/dọn phòng;
Example:
a. Eloise's first job at the hotel was as a housekeeper and now she is the manager.
b. The desk clerk is sending the housekeeper to bring more towels to your room.

Vietnamese: báo, thông báo, khai báo, cho biết;
Example:
a. They notified the hotel that they had been delayed in traffic and would be arriving late.
b. Lydia notified the hotel in writing that she was canceling her reservation.

Vietnamese: loại trừ, trừ bỏ, ngăn ngừa; đẩy xa;
Example:
a. The horrible rainstorm precluded us from traveling any further.
b. The unexpected cost of the room precluded a gourmet dinner for the travelers.

Vietnamese: (v): trích dẫn; định giá, báo giá; (n): sự trích dẫn, lời trích dẫn, đoạn trích dẫn
Example:
a. We were quoted a price of $89 for the room for one night.
b. Call ahead and get a price quote for a week-long stay.

Vietnamese: suất, mức, giá (giá được tính theo các nấc căn cứ theo chất lượng), tỷ lệ;
Example:
a. The rate for the hotel room is too high considering how few services are available on-site.
b. The sign in the lobby lists the seasonal rates.

Vietnamese: (sự) giữ trước, đặt trước; sự dành riêng, khu vực dành riêng;
Example:
a. I know I made a reservation for tonight, but the hotel staff has no record of it in the system.
b. It is difficult, if not impossible, to get reservations at this hotel at the height of the summer season.

Vietnamese: (n): dịch vụ, sự phục vụ; (v): phục vụ;
Example:
a. The hotel has a number of luxury services like the on-site gym, sauna, pool, and beauty salon.
b. Mr. Rockmont called room service to order a late-night snack.

Vietnamese: xác nhận, thừa nhận; chứng thực, phê chuẩn (to validate)
Example:
a. Jorge called the hotel to confirm that he had a room reservation.
b. We automatically send a postcard to let you know that your travel dates have been confirmed.

Vietnamese: bận, bận rộn;
Example:
a. Alfred was busy getting ready for his vacation.
b. The airport was busy, with people catching planes and heading for car rental companies.

Vietnamese: trùng khớp, trùng hợp, trùng nhau; xảy ra đồng thời;
Example:
a. My cousin's wedding coincided with a holiday weekend, so it was a perfect time to rent a car and go for a drive.
b. Sean was hoping that the days for the special discount on car rentals would coincide with his vacation, but they did not.

Vietnamese:
(sự) lộn xộn, hỗn loạn; (sự) mơ hồ, mập mờ;
(sự) lẫn lộn, nhầm lẫn; (sự) bối rối, xấu hổ
Example:
a. There was some confusion about which rental discount coupons applied to which car rental agency.
b. To avoid any confusion about renting the car, Yolanda asked her travel agent to make the arrangements on her behalf.

Vietnamese:
(sự/chỗ) chạm, tiếp xúc, giao tiếp, giao dịch, gặp gỡ;
verb : tiếp xúc với, đụng chạm vào, gặp gỡ;
Example:
a. Manuel contacted at least a dozen car rental agencies to get the best deal.
b. Last night I was contacted by my travel agent who said he had found a better price on a car rental.

Vietnamese: (v): thất vọng, chán ngán; nhụt chí, nản lòng; thất hứa, thất ước;
Example:
a. Leila was disappointed to discover that no rental cars were available the weekend she wished to travel.
b. I hate to disappoint you, but I can't allow you to rent a car unless you have a major credit card.

Vietnamese: định, dự định, có ý định;
Example:
a. I never intended to drive to Los Angeles until my brother suggested we do it together.
b. Do you intend to return the car to this location or to another location?

Vietnamese: sự cho phép, đăng ký; giấy phép, bằng, chứng chỉ (cho phép làm gì đó);
Example:
a. First, I'll need to see your driver's license and a major credit card.
b. You will need a license in order to run this business.

Vietnamese: lo lắng, bồn chồn, căng thẳng;
Example:
a. As we approached the city Lonnie started driving nervously, so I volunteered to drive that part of the trip.
b. I looked around nervously the entire time I was in the dark parking garage.

Vietnamese: tùy ý, tùy chọn, không bắt buộc;
Example:
a. Check this box if you wish to have this optional insurance.
b. Having a driver's license is not optional.

Vietnamese: cám dỗ, khêu gợi, quyến rũ; xúi, xúi giục, kích động;
Example:
a. I am tempted by the idea of driving across the country instead of flying.
b. Gina is tempted to rent the smaller car to save a few dollars.

Vietnamese: run lên, rùng mình; rộn lên, rộn ràng; rung cảm, xúc động;
Example:
a. The thought of renting a sports car gave John a thrill.
b. Just taking a vacation is thrill enough, even if we are driving instead of flying.

Vietnamese: hạng, tầng, lớp, tầng lớp;
Example:
a. The car rental company had a few tiers of cars, each one costing more than the previous tier.
b. If you are on a budget, I suggest you think about renting a car from our lowest tier.

Vietnamese: sự đạt được, sự giành được; (số nhiều) tài năng, kỹ năng, kiến thức
Example:
a. The actress received a lot of attention for her many professional attainments.
b. The attainment of an Academy Award validates a performer's career.

Vietnamese: kết hợp, phối hợp
Example:
a. The director combined two previously separate visual techniques.
b. The new production company combines the talents of three of Hollywood's best known teams.

Vietnamese: tiếp tục, tiếp diễn, làm tiếp, duy trì;
Example:
a. The film continues the story set out in an earlier film.
b. The search for a star will continue until one is found.

Vietnamese: (sự) diễn tả, mô tả; diện mạo, hình dạng
Example:
a. The description of the film did not match what we saw on screen.
b. The critic's description of the film made it sound very appealing.

Vietnamese: giải tán, xua tan; gieo rắc, truyền (tin đồn);
Example:
a. The reporters dispersed after the press agent cancelled the interview with the film director.
b. The crowd outside the movie premiere would not disperse until they had seen the movie stars.

Vietnamese: sự giải trí, tiêu khiển
Example:
a. The movie was provided for our entertainment.
b. There was not entertainment for children of guests at the hotel.

Vietnamese: ảnh hưởng đến, tác động đến, khiến cho;
Example:
a. The editor's style influenced a generation of film editors.
b. The producer was able to influence the town council to allow her to film in the park.

Vietnamese: dải, vùng, phạm vi, lĩnh vực, tầm (scope);
Example:
a. The range of the director's vision is impressive.
b. What is the price range you are willing pay for a ticket to the premiere?

Vietnamese: phát hành; thả, phóng thích, giải thoát; làm nhẹ, làm bớt (đau);
Example:
a. The film was finally realeased to movie theaters after many delays.
b. The producers of the film are hoping to release it in time for the holidays.

Vietnamese: đại diện, thay mặt; tiêu biểu, tượng trưng; diễn tả, đóng vai;
Example:
a. The actor's representation of his character did not seem authentic.
b. The film's representation of world poverty through the character of the hungry child was quite moving.

Vietnamese: tách rời, riêng rẽ;
Example:
a. Each scene of the movie was filmed separately from the others.
b. The theater was very crowded so we had to sit separately.

Vietnamese: kế tiếp, liên tiếp, liên tục; lần lượt
Example:
a. The script went through successive rewrites.
b. Somehow the successive images were interrupted and had to be edited again.

Vietnamese: (sự/cách) hành động, hoạt động, làm việc; chuỗi sự kiện (truyện, sân khấu);
Example:
a. The director decided that the second act needed more action and asked the playwright to review the work.
b. The action on stage was spellbinding.

Vietnamese: tiến gần, tiếp cận; đường tiến vào, lối vào; thăm dò, tiếp xúc;
Example:
a. The performance approaches perfection.
b. The director approached the play from unusual angle.

Vietnamese: có thể đến gần, tới gần được, thân thiện, dễ tiếp cận;
Example:
a. Malcolm is always very approachable – talk it over with him.
b. Graham's always very approachable - why don't you talk the problem over with him?

Vietnamese: khán giả, thính giả, độc giả;
Example:
a. The audience cheered the actors as they walked off the stage.
b. The playwright expanded his audience by writing for film as well as for stage.

Vietnamese: sáng tạo;
Example:
a. The writer's creative representation of the Seven Deadly Sins was astounding.
b. There are a number of creative people writing for the theater these days.

Vietnamese: (n): cuộc đối thoại; (v): đối thoại;
Example:
a. The actors performed the dialogue without using scripts.
b. The written dialogue seemed great, but was hard to perform.

Vietnamese: yếu tố, nhân tố, nguyên tố;
Example:
a. The audience is an essential element of live theater.
b. By putting togetther all the elements of theater into one play, he overwhelmed the critics.

Vietnamese: kinh nghiệm, trải qua
Example:
a. The experience of live theater is very thrilling. 
b. Going to the theater was not part of Claude's experience growing up.

Vietnamese: xuất hiện; xảy ra, xảy đến;
Example:
a. The murder in the play occurs in the second act.
b. It never occurred to me that the wife whom the character referred to was imaginary.

Vietnamese: thực hiện, thi hành; trình bày, biểu diễn, đóng vai;
Example:
a. The theater group performed a three-act play.
b. Juan performed the role without forgetting any lines.

Vietnamese: nhắc lại, kể lại; diễn tập (kịch, múa...);
Example:
a. The players rehearsed for only three weeks before the show opened.
b. The director rehearses with the actors ten hours each day.

Vietnamese: Sự phê bình, lời phê bình, duyệt, xem lại;
Example:
a. The critic's influential review of the play was so negative that it sank the entire production.
b. The newspaper sent a rank amateur to review the play.

Vietnamese: bán hết, bán sạch (vé); bán rẻ hết, bán tống bán tháo;
Example:
a. The Broadway opening sold out months in advance.
b. We expect that this play will be a smash and sell out quickly.

Vietnamese: sẵn có, sẵn sàng (để dùng, để phục vụ);
Example:
a. In order to understand all the words to the opera, Sue Lin kept an Italian dictionary available at all times.
b. I checked the list of available compact discs before ordering.

Vietnamese: mở rộng, nới rộng;
Example:
a. Dominique wants to broaden her knowledge of opera history.
b. You will appreciate music more if you broaden your tastes and listen to several types of music.

Vietnamese: hạng, loại
Example:
a. Jazz is one of many categories of music.
b. The works of Mozart are in a category by themselves.

Vietnamese: khác biệt, khác loại, khác hẳn nhau;
Example:
a. In the song, the disparate voices hauntingly join a blended chorus.
b. Religious song cut across disparate categories of music.

Vietnamese: chia ra, phân chia; chia rẽ, ly gián;
Example:
a. The music class was evenly divided between those who liked country and western music and those who do not.
b. The broad topic of music can be divided into manageable parts, such as themes, styles, or centuries.

Vietnamese: chiếu cố, thiên vị; thích, thiện cảm;
Example:
a. Sam enjoys the works of several composers but he tends to favor Mozart.
b. I'd favor an evening at a jazz concert over an evening at the opera any time.

Vietnamese: bản năng; năng khiếu, thiên hướng;
Example:
a. The student's ability to play the cello was so natural, it seemed an instinct.
b. The music lover followed his instincts and collected only music that he enjoyed.

Vietnamese: ưa thích hơn, thích cái gì hơn
Example:
a. He preferred contemporary music to any other type.
b. Ms. Lanet prefers to get a seat near the aisle when she attends a concert.

Vietnamese: (n): lý do, lý lẽ; lý trí, lẽ phải; (v): suy luận, lý luận; tranh luận, cãi lý;
Example:
a. We'll never understand the reason why some music is popular and some is not.
b. There is every reason to believe that Beethoven will still be popular in the next century.

Vietnamese: thư giãn, sự nghỉ ngơi, sự giải trí
Example:
a. Listening to soothing music before bedtime provides good relaxation.
b. He played the piano for relaxation and pleasure.

Vietnamese: sở thích,thị hiếu, vị giác;
Example:
a. Ella had the taste required to select a musical program for the visiting dignitaries.
b. This music does not appeal to my tastes; but I'm not old-fashioned.

Vietnamese: thúc giục, thúc đẩy, thôi thúc; cố nài, cố thuyết phục;
Example:
a. His mother urged him to study the piano; the rest is musical history.
b. Despite my reluctance, my friends urged me to attend an opera.

Vietnamese: đạt được, thu được, giành được, kiếm được (obtain);
Example:
a. The museum acquired a Van Gogh during heavy bidding.
b. The sculptor acquired metalworking skills after much practice.

Vietnamese: khâm phục, thán phục; hâm mộ, ngưỡng mộ;
Example:
a. Raisa, admiring the famous smile, stood before the Mona Lisa for hours.
b. I admire all the effort the museum put into organizing this wonderful exhibit.

Vietnamese: (sự) sưu tầm, thu thập; (sự/tiền) quyên góp; nhóm người/đồ vật
Example:
a. The museum's collection contained many works donated by famous collectors.
b. The museum's collection kept two full-time curators busy.

Vietnamese: (sự/lời) phê bình, chỉ trích, phê phán, bình phẩm
Example:
a. According to the criticism of the Victorian era, the painting was a masterpiece; now it is considered merely a minor work.
b. The revered artist's criticism of the piece was particularly insightful.

Vietnamese: thời trang, mốt; hình dáng, kiểu cách;
Example:
a. According to the fashion of the day, the languid pose of the sculpture was high art.
b. The museum's classical architecture has never gone out of fashion.

Vietnamese: (lúc/thời gian) nhàn rỗi, nhàn hạ
Example:
a. The woman took up painting in her retirement, when she had more leisure time.
b. We can go to the permanent collection at our leisure.

Vietnamese: phản ứng lại (react); đáp lại, đáp ứng, hưởng ứng (reply);
Example:
a. You should respond to the invitation to attend the museum gala.
b. The visitors who viewed those poignant photographs responded emotionally.

Vietnamese: (n): thời gian biểu; (v): ghi vào thời gian biểu, dự định thời gian biểu;
Example:
a. We didn't schedule enough time to see all the exhibits that we were interested in.
b. The museum is scheduling a collection of works by Japanese masters.

Vietnamese: quan trọng, trọng đại, hệ trọng, đầy ý nghĩa;
Example:
a. The use of lambs to symbolize innocence is significant in Western art.
b. The rash of new acquisitions represented a significant change in the museum's policies.

Vietnamese: chuyên môn hóa, chuyên về, đặc trưng về;
Example:
a. The art historian specialized in Navajo rugs.
b. The museum shop specializes in Ming vases.

Vietnamese: phổ, quang phổ; một dải rộng (về hoạt động, ý tưởng, chất lượng...);
Example:
a. The painting crosses the spectrum from symbolic to realistic representation.
b. The whole spectrum of artistic expression was represented in the exhibit.

Vietnamese: biểu lộ, bày tỏ, diễn đạt; gửi nhanh, gửi tốc hành
Example:
a. The sculptor was able to express his feelings better through the use of clay rather than words.
b. The photograph expresses a range of emotions.

Vietnamese: (sự) giao việc, phân công; quy là, cho là; nhiệm vụ, công việc;
Example:
a. This assignment has to be turned in before midnight.
b. When the reporter is on assignment, research piles up on her desk.

Vietnamese: lựa chọn
Example:
a. Alan chooses to read The New York Times over the Wall Street Journal.
b. I did not choose that candidate to be the editor of our student newspaper.

Vietnamese: liên miên, luôn luôn (always, continuely);
Example:
a. An advantage of Internet news reports is that they can be constantly updated.
b. People constantly look to the news to keep up-to-date on what is going on in the world.

Vietnamese: cấu tạo, tạo thành (to form); thiết lập, thành lập (to establish)
Example:
a. All the different news sources constitute the media industry.
b. A talented staff, adequate printing facilities, and sufficient distribution points constitute a successful newspaper.

Vietnamese: sự quyết định; ‹sự› giải quyết, phân xử, phán quyết;
Example:
a. The court made the decision to allow the newspaper to print the controversial story.
b. Newspaper editors often have to make quick decisions about which stories to publish.

Vietnamese: truyền bá, phổ biến, reo rắc;
Example:
a. The media disseminates news across the world.
b. The computer virus was disseminated through the newsroom by reporters sharing terminals.

Vietnamese: (sự/sức) va mạnh, va chạm mạnh, tác động mạnh, ảnh hưởng mạnh;
Example:
a. The story of the presidential scandal had a huge impact on the public.
b. The impact of the news coverage is yet to be known.

Vietnamese: tỷ mỉ, cẩn thận, chu đáo, chi tiết;
Example:
a. The newspaper gave in-depth coverage of the tragic bombing.
b. Ivan's in-depth story on the spread of the disease received praise from many of his colleagues.

Vietnamese: điều tra, nghiên cứu
Example:
a. Reporters need to thoroughly investigate the facts before publishing their stories.
b. Michelle's editor sent her to the capital to investigate the story behind the government scandal.

Vietnamese: liên kết, kết hợp
Example:
a. The computer links will take you to today's headlines.
b. The father-daughter team of reporters is just one example of many family links at this newspaper.

Vietnamese: quyên, góp; đặt (báo), đặt mua dài hạn, theo dõi lâu dài;
Example:
a. Jill subscribes to a gardening magazine.
b. It is convenience to subscribe to the newspaper because it is delivered to your house daily.

Vietnamese: thấu đáo, triệt để, hoàn toàn, trọn vẹn; tỉ mỉ, kỹ lưỡng;
Example:
a. The reporters were thorough in their coverage of the event.
b. The story was the result of thorough research.

Vietnamese: hàng năm, từng nằm, thường niên (yearly);
Example:
a. Everyone should get a physical exam annually.
b. A number of tests are provided annually by my insurance plan.

Vietnamese: sự hẹn gặp, giấy mời; chức vụ được bổ nhiệm, sắc lệnh;
Example:
a. To get the most out of your appointment, keep a log of your symptoms and concerns.
b. The psychiatrist holds an academic appointment at the university hospital as well as having a private practice.

Vietnamese: ước định, định lượng, đánh giá
Example:
a. The physical therapist assessed the amount of mobility Ms. Crowl had lost after her stroke.
b. The insurance rate Mr. Victor was assessed went up this year after he admitted that he had started smoking again.

Vietnamese: chẩn đoán
Example:
a. After considering the patient's symptoms and looking at his test results, the doctor diagnosed the lump as benign. 
b. She diagnosed the problem as a failure to follow the directions for taking the medication.

Vietnamese: lời chuẩn đoán
Example:
a. Diagnosis of the disease is difficult in the early stages.
b. When we get the results of your blood tests, I should be able to give you a clear diagnosis.

Vietnamese: (có) kết quả, tác dụng; (có) hiệu quả, hiệu lực
Example:
a. Howard was pleased to find that the diet recommended by his doctor was quite effective.
b. The new policies, effective the beginning of the fiscal year, change the amount charged to see the physician.

Vietnamese: dụng cụ, công cụ, thiết bị đo đạc; trái phiếu, nhạc cụ;
Example:
a. The pediatrician tried not to frighten the children with her strange-looking instruments.
b. The senior physician carried his instruments in a black leather bag.

Vietnamese:
quản lý, trông nom, điều khiển, sai khiến (handle);
giải quyết, xử lý, xoay xở được (deal with); chỉ đạo, chỉ dẫn, dạy bảo (guide);
Example:
